channel.title: A-Frame
channel.description: A web framework for building virtual reality experiences. Make WebVR with HTML and Entity-Component. Works on Vive, Rift, desktop, mobile platforms.

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 153 - 154
item.description:
🔥 Hot reloading @aframevr HTML, components, and shaders. Save changes to your code and watch your #vr scene update live. Never refresh the browser again! https://t.co/1ZDGQCoFvj pic.twitter.com/heoMiXcneY

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) February 26, 2019

It was cool seeing how something I sketched out could translate into a real experience thanks to the power of developer magic ð¥ð¥ð¥.

My dreams of exploding virtual barrels had finally been realized!#IWD2019 #InternationalWomansDay @aframevr #webVR #vrgames pic.twitter.com/IsZ3uR3Rvj

— gskinner (@gskinner_team) March 8, 2019

I created an installation that generates unique art for every interaction using blockchain, augmented reality from @jerome_etienne's AR.js and 3D models from @aframevr. Here you can see it in action: https://t.co/3gPNETMjvu

— manuel basanta (@manuelbasanta) March 4, 2019

Fire Blocks VR - License our HTML5 VR games for your brand or website. No download required, please contact us for more info.https://t.co/tkYKcSjLeW #webxr #webvr #html5games #html5 #vr #virtualreality #vrgames #daydream #oculus #gearvr #webgames #onlinegames @aframevr pic.twitter.com/HSagBGMFso

— DS Effects (@dseffects) March 1, 2019

Square Box VR - License our HTML5 VR games for your brand or website. No download required, please contact us for more info.https://t.co/rsr4RKpqdM#webxr #webvr #html5games #html5 #vr #virtualreality #vrgames #daydream #oculus #gearvr #webgames #onlinegames @aframevr pic.twitter.com/FTsxw1ZdHb

— DS Effects (@dseffects) March 6, 2019

Frame Academy Project 5: Bringing Audio, Video, + 360 Video in WebXR is now live. Now at Frame Academy: 5 Projects, 20 pages of content, + 20 videos to take you from scratch to building cross-platform immersive experiences w/ @aframevr . https://t.co/YaM0d2c88m #arvrinedu #edtech pic.twitter.com/CgSltjcX1J

— Gabriel Baker (@gabrieljbaker) February 25, 2019

Capitals AR - License our HTML5 AR games for your brand or website. No download required, please contact us for more info.#webxr #webar #markerless #html5games #html5 #ar #augmentedreality #argames #threejs @aframevr pic.twitter.com/7gxWkN3hp6

— DS Effects (@dseffects) February 25, 2019

More work in progress #WebXR @aframevr meets #ProjectionMapping meets @NYCTBus for my @GrayAreaorg "semester" project! Tracking is loose by a few centimeters but good enough for fun. pic.twitter.com/JBXNaAGFFH

— Kieran Farr (@kfarr) March 6, 2019

Been working on optimizing Viola Desmond's @circlesxr worlds for @oculus GO @aframevr. Starting to feel that maybe #GLTF isn't the way to go. With #OBJ static models I can swap out high-res textures at run-time, add/remove others maps (e.g. normal) etc … #unsure pic.twitter.com/udZkZmG2nN

Components

Just published my new @aframevr component!

Spawn entities randomly around a spawnpoint:https://t.co/I1gmibD7EY#aframevr #aframe #webvr pic.twitter.com/SL8XKPJ7sm

— Nathaniel (@banada) March 7, 2019

https://t.co/8IULysBuIw#aframevr component

— Antonio (@antonio_hof) February 27, 2019

Articles

"If you aren't familiar with @aframevr, then you might be missing out on one of the most unique experiences on the web." Visit our latest blog post for an introduction: https://t.co/XGDCDhq9p3 pic.twitter.com/eX3oFjnZz3

— Aquent DEV6 (@DEV6tweet) March 6, 2019

Events

Digital Design students @IICS1911 taking their first steps from programming static HTML websites into coding @aframevr #VirtualReality experiences as @SustDev advocacy experiences later this semester. #ARVRinEDU pic.twitter.com/i0ZXihF1yr

— Clint Carlson (@clinty) March 6, 2019

First speaker of the night: @utopiah who is showing us how you can create #VR in the browser using @aframevr #CodePenBelgium pic.twitter.com/8MvrHxPfNG

— Creative Front-end Belgium (@frontendbe) March 7, 2019

Starting this years #aframe_nyc season with swag @firefox reality & @supermediumvr stickers for all the brave members that joined us despite the weather #WebXR - for all folks that missed it refer to the presentation https://t.co/YBle5kstq0 & check out our new meetup structure pic.twitter.com/wwYR5uWHyD

— Roland Dubois (@rolanddubois) February 21, 2019

Always so exciting to give someone their first time in 6DoF #VR. When someone tried 3DoF and think they know #VR then are able to step in their drawing… such a special moment 😊 Showcasing #apainter made with @AFrameVR on a so practical @Samsung Odyssey 👌 pic.twitter.com/OgfddXcmMo

— Fabien Benetou (@utopiah) March 7, 2019

Preparing my 3D/#VR/#AR/#WebXR presentation for @frontendbe tomorrow evening when I realized that I could plug my 13" ultra laptop and the resulting display would still be touch sensitive 😱

Probably the largest touch screen I used @AFrameVR on! pic.twitter.com/6m7webaIvS

— Fabien Benetou (@utopiah) March 6, 2019

Good morning! We are starting our hackathon with an intro to #WebVR , @aframevr and @glitch . Next up: creating our first CGI stories with our product @xrdok. Thank you @MIZBabelsberg for again providing this space! pic.twitter.com/wKe2v358V5

— Vragments (@Vragments) February 25, 2019

7th graders diving into VR creation using my WebXR tutorials on Frame Academy? In my feels. 😭 #arvrinedu https://t.co/eb4IWcwG6z @aframevr @andgokevin @dmarcos https://t.co/wGSBG37Xlo

— Gabriel Baker (@gabrieljbaker) February 28, 2019

Let me introduce the fabulous XRDOK starter kit for our @vragments hackathon next monday in order to get an idea about @aframevr @glitch and of course @xrdok ☞ https://t.co/2Y8wXBSrRp pic.twitter.com/QMGa3XhUZj

— Marcus Bösch (@m_boesch) February 22, 2019

Wow our first SF #WebXR meetup of the year is coming together for tomorrow night! Demos from @EmblematicGroup, @aframevr, @jmarshworks, yours truly, and more! We've joined forces this week with @GrayAreaorg, so note the new location in the Mission https://t.co/3NxNKFto7i

— Kieran Farr (@kfarr) February 21, 2019

At the end of the day, our participants started working on first XR stories, using @aframevr @glitch and @xrdok. Thank y‘all for coming, we will keep you updated with new components, templates and use cases via @MIZBabelsberg pic.twitter.com/KWuMd1t2X2

— Vragments (@Vragments) February 25, 2019

Day 1 of @SXSWEDU is a wrap! TIL ways to bring #AI learning into the classroom (thanks @nvidia), how to enable students to create their own #VR experiences using @aframevr & most importantly: Finding ways to empower young minds through engineering & tech pic.twitter.com/6nmZfxLX6V

— Ashley West📍#SXSWEdu (@ashleywest_ou) March 5, 2019

We've incorporated @aframevr VR into @adobecaptivate (@AdobeELearning)https://t.co/BmezC4CzTZ#vrwolweek #VirtualReality #elearning #experimental @learningplan @ryantracey

— John Stericker (@johnstericker) February 25, 2019

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 149 - 152
item.description:
⚡ A-Frame v0.9.0 has been released! Perf improvements, Inspector updates. And initial WebXR support (shout-out to @ExpWithGoogle for helping fund the work w/ @supermediumvr)! Big thanks for everyone's contributions for making VR (and AR) more awesome! 🤜 https://t.co/p20i7Zcif3 pic.twitter.com/7bHTcaaa32

— A-Frame (@aframevr) February 11, 2019

We built an experience to explore three trims on all-new Chevy Silverado. Check it out now in 3D. https://t.co/c4es2eC4UC @aframevr @isobarUS

— Zach DeBord (@zacharydebord) January 26, 2019

This was sort of glossed over. But Sony's $1 million dollar sweepstakes 360/VR challenge for marketing their Hollywood movie "Escape Room" was built with @aframevr! https://t.co/PDbnA4XHyi pic.twitter.com/ESoBSdnmkd

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) February 1, 2019

Learn how to build a VR experience with our new WebVR Starter Kit: a free, 5-part video course with interactive code examples that will teach you the fundamentals of #WebVR using @aframevr https://t.co/muUVCXm4Te pic.twitter.com/zng2LXniyk

— 🎏Glitch (@glitch) February 12, 2019

item.title: A-Frame v0.9.0 - Perf & Initial WebXR
item.description:
Over the last year, we’ve continued to try to push the limits of the Web to produce VR content that stands on its own alongside the native apps and games found on the stores. At Supermedium, we developed content such as Soundboxing WebVR alongside @ericflo, Supercraft, and the BeatSaver Viewer.

We’re starting to highlight usage of A-Frame by companies such as Disney, Ford, Toyota, Chevrolet, Sony, Samsung, Google, CERN, Magic Leap, Electronic Frontier Foundation, NPR, and NASA. See the new and developing A-Frame showcase on the website.

And thanks to Google Creative Labs for financially supporting development of initial WebXR support through us at Supermedium in this release of A-Frame.
item.content:encoded:
Over the last year, we’ve continued to try to push the limits of the Web to produce VR content that stands on its own alongside the native apps and games found on the stores. At Supermedium, we developed content such as Soundboxing WebVR alongside @ericflo, Supercraft, and the BeatSaver Viewer.

We’re starting to highlight usage of A-Frame by companies such as Disney, Ford, Toyota, Chevrolet, Sony, Samsung, Google, CERN, Magic Leap, Electronic Frontier Foundation, NPR, and NASA. See the new and developing A-Frame showcase on the website.

And thanks to Google Creative Labs for financially supporting development of initial WebXR support through us at Supermedium in this release of A-Frame.

What’s New?

Major changes to A-Frame involve large performance improvements, a new animation component, Inspector updates, addition of oculus-go-controls + vive-focus-controls, and introductory WebXR support. Note that the release date of WebXR is indefinite a few years under discussion and is not yet parity with the WebVR 1.1 standard from five years back. A-Frame will do its best to smooth out the flux. We may ship an 0.9.1 since WebXR has already broken with Chrome Canary. Biggest things to note for migrating is that:

  • <a-animation> has been removed in favor of the animation component (a back-polyfill exists). We are currently working on fixing some memory leaks in anime.js .
  • Raycaster event APIs have slightly changed.

The Inspector has also received some overhaul with stability, bug fixes, performance improvements, a complete refactoring, UI enhancements, and now a companion server to sync changes back to your HTML files with the A-Frame Watcher!

👀 @aframevr Watcher, a companion to the @aframevr Inspector that can sync changes from the visual editor to your HTML files. Supported on master branch of the Inspector.

Useful for tweaking positions, laying out text w/o going between code + browser. https://t.co/SmTTrljqWA pic.twitter.com/qQxv8KvhQS

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) December 15, 2018

See the release notes or changelog for more details.

What Have People Built?

Let’s check out what people have built how world-renowned companies have released production projects using A-Frame! Also see the new [A-Frame Showcase].

EFF's Spot the Surveillance virtual reality project places you in a street scene, where you learn to identify a variety of police technologies. https://t.co/LuXEJu8atV

— EFF (@EFF) November 23, 2018

Check out the new updated version of our #webgl Camry Configurator, built using @aframevr and #threejs 🙌 https://t.co/rO8pUJwgsf pic.twitter.com/3umySnTMp8

— Rotor Studios (@rotorstudios) June 4, 2018

Check out the the all-new 2019 Chevrolet Silverado in 3D! https://t.co/zJ0g7Kadq2 Made with @aframevr & threejs pic.twitter.com/LVZgxxchgx

— Allan Cozart (@ALLANCOZART) January 18, 2019

This was sort of glossed over. But Sony's $1 million dollar sweepstakes 360/VR challenge for marketing their Hollywood movie "Escape Room" was built with @aframevr! https://t.co/PDbnA4XHyi pic.twitter.com/ESoBSdnmkd

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) February 1, 2019

Hidden Mickey from Disney developed by @shaunmnemonic:

Inside Music from Google, Song Exploder developed by tambien and help from Supermedium:

Access Mars from Google, NASA with help from Supermedium:

Here are some companies, startups, and studios that have leaned on A-Frame and thus some pretty fun jobs created!

Build, collaborate, and share your world with anyone around the globe. #XR4all @magicleap @MadewMagicLeap pic.twitter.com/VDna4EfpNZ

— 3Data (@3DataCloud) December 7, 2018

We've done it again! The Camry #WebGL Configurator has won the Visionary Award at the @summitawards for Emerging Media. It's such an honour to be recognised again for this innovative project - try it here: https://t.co/L1HMXwd7cd @aframevr #threejs 🏆🍾🙌 pic.twitter.com/56CkHJeq7l

— Rotor Studios (@rotorstudios) January 11, 2019

Imagine a world where you can create #VR, #AR, 360 & #3D content with zero coding by simply dragging and dropping. Say Hello to Scapic. We know you'll love this.

Try out the Scapic Editor - https://t.co/GmzUPVI4VM#VirtualReality #AugmentedReality pic.twitter.com/uwlR1lQA6w

— Scapic (@scapicxr) October 19, 2018

Check out #craftblocks by @sgidon! A fully featured voxel editor built with #8thWallWeb and @aframevr. Share your art with others using #ARCameras at https://t.co/edq86qaKvP. Try it in Safari (iOS) or in Android browsers today! pic.twitter.com/ujJeHEaU3u

— 8th Wall (@the8thwall) December 13, 2018

And some more cool A-Frame projects:

The new triple combo with a defense element. It's not easy, but a good combination and reaction training. Go to the tower and set to random combo.https://t.co/2CJMMthk8G or try it out in @supermediumvr browser#vrfitness #vrboxing #vrworkout #vr #boxing #workout #fitness pic.twitter.com/NTTCPoCsVc

— TowermaxFitness (@towermaxfitness) December 15, 2018

👐 Need someone to talk to? Put on a little show with these cute hand "vuppets" by @jorgefuentesnet! Built with @aframevr #webvr. Now playing on @supermediumvr. pic.twitter.com/UZFHAITWr4

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) November 26, 2018

⚔️ We teamed up w/ the Beat Saber Modding Group & elliotttate to release the open source BeatSaver Viewer! Preview + link community songs on any browser (iOS soon) powered by @aframevr/#webvr. Featured on https://t.co/vj8PxhqxQg!https://t.co/pWKmNRnZdJ https://t.co/eWbcHXuIuz pic.twitter.com/CR4sA8MzKs

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) January 26, 2019

👊 True VR warriors need not weapons. Punch your way through hundreds of songs with @soundboxingvr! Made with @aframevr long ago in collaboration with @ericflo. Burn some calories on @supermediumvr. pic.twitter.com/ANrlF34Etb

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) November 1, 2018

🔫 pewpew, @aframevr Super Shooter Kit! A simple set of components to make a #webvr shooter minigame in no time. Featuring a rapid workflow with #supercraft for live reloading + in-VR + micro file size + low poly assets! https://t.co/0LV9aw83Ke pic.twitter.com/J2Q4gGnaOI

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) July 26, 2018

I'm unbelievably excited to share a preview release of Hubs by Mozilla, a new Mixed Reality-based communications platform we are building. All open source, and all running in your browser, powered by WebVR. Really!https://t.co/AtYqAn2qam

— Greg Fodor (@gfodor) April 26, 2018

Can you get to the Top 10?? SUPER SAYS, a simon clone for VR, available on @supermediumvr for 6dof controllers (#Oculus #HTCVive #mixedreality) https://t.co/DHivKcO0Bh 1 day to create, 2 weeks to polish ¯_(ツ)_/¯ pic.twitter.com/gY7gkLqk60

— Diego F. Goberna (@feiss) May 2, 2018

🏆🥚 Gunters of OASIS. Hundreds of generated #webvr worlds. Hidden among them a golden egg. Find the egg and inherit the OASIS (and half a hundred dollars). Search for hidden clues, meet up with other Gunters. Ready? Start the hunt on @supermediumvr!https://t.co/oTKimoCrFM pic.twitter.com/jyaPoUGHEW

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) April 4, 2018

I've updated Trajectile Command with a high score leaderboard and a kickin sound track. Try it out on @supermediumvr or another vr browser here: https://t.co/6vL9vyfDSQ … Can you beat my high score?? @aframevr #VR #webvr #webgl pic.twitter.com/vy9oQYaO6K

— Adam Alexander (@AdamAlexandr) June 3, 2018

ð Need someone to talk to? Put on a little show with these cute hand "vuppets" by @jorgefuentesnet! Built with @aframevr #webvr. Now playing on @supermediumvr. pic.twitter.com/UZFHAITWr4

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) November 26, 2018

Numbers

  • 268 contributors with 45 new contributors since March 2018
  • 1,600 total questions asked on StackOverflow
  • 370,000+ people visited aframe.io since March 2018
  • 3,200,000+ pageviews since March 2018
  • Over 9000! GitHub stars
  • 145+ entries of A Week of A-Frame and still going!

What’s Next?

We will ensure that A-Frame runs well on the Oculus Quest, and that there is a place for users to experience A-Frame applications. A-Frame will continue to keep up to date on the WebXR flux. We need to update documentation, guides, and examples. And there are some lingering improvements we want to make to the A-Frame API. Perhaps provide more streamlined tools for A-Frame development.

Thanks to everyone for filing issues, contributing, and sharing your projects!

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 145
item.description:
We’re still working on 0.9.0. Diego is doing lot of testing with the WebXR support which is a lot of work given the flux and discovering issues with the spec, and is triaging through A-Frame issues. We expect it next week. In the meantime, check out this week’s featured projects including the BeatSaver Viewer from us at Supermedium, and usage by Chevrolet!

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 139
item.description:
Check out #craftblocks by @sgidon! A fully featured voxel editor built with #8thWallWeb and @aframevr. Share your art with others using #ARCameras at https://t.co/edq86qaKvP. Try it in Safari (iOS) or in Android browsers today! pic.twitter.com/ujJeHEaU3u

— 8th Wall (@the8thwall) December 13, 2018

👀 @aframevr Watcher, a companion to the @aframevr Inspector that can sync changes from the visual editor to your HTML files. Supported on master branch of the Inspector.

Useful for tweaking positions, laying out text w/o going between code + browser. https://t.co/SmTTrljqWA pic.twitter.com/qQxv8KvhQS

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) December 15, 2018

Watch as @unity3d's Adam and Lieutenant (@glTF3D models) are discovered in a mysterious #vr world created entirely in @aframevr. All audio is dynamic and in-browser. It's amazing how this can all be a result of a single html page! #unity3d #virtualreality @mozillareality pic.twitter.com/zoTtHM7t4f

— Diego (@dmarcos) December 1, 2018

Using the basics of @aframevr, a player can walk around a world similar to #Mars and clean up the environment by erasing animated shapes using the cursor #webvr #VirtualReality #vr https://t.co/hkSTjm0kpQ

— Nathan Stevens (@nathantstevens) December 4, 2018

My contribution to the world of VR (thanks @aframevr @OculusMedium ) https://t.co/wGiFW0hWHG pic.twitter.com/1onRclgYCJ

— Zach Capalbo (@zach_geek) December 4, 2018

Analyzing colors with #aframe @aframevr in #virtualreality has never been more fun! Walk through this #vr world and collect colors from shapes to update your cursor color and display the hexadecimal value of the material. #future #technology #futurism pic.twitter.com/z2TYxVwWDU

— Nathan Stevens (@nathantstevens) December 5, 2018

一人での開発はなかなか辛い。#webVR #webXR pic.twitter.com/xKZguKRux5

It's easier than ever to collaborative in immersive VR, right from a web browser. The Frame Alpha works on desktop, mobile, and just about any VR headset. Create persistent 3D scenes and use them for meetings and classes https://t.co/bc9qIRjCwD #webxr #glTF #arvrinedu pic.twitter.com/xR2lhKwVUf

— Frame VR (@frame_vr) November 26, 2018

Got some large environments from @sketchfab coming to the Frame Gallery. I like this one because users have room to break into small groups and hold separate conversations without feeling cramped! https://t.co/eb4IWcwG6z #arvrinedu #webxr @aframevr pic.twitter.com/ZbGZUCx7EE

You have to try this #webXR from @TriggerGlobal @the8thwall and @awscloud It just takes a sec and I promise you'll go "wow" https://t.co/5fKiUBErnd thanks @AlanSmithson1 for the link! @samanthagwolfe @CathyHackl @HelenSitu @ForbesTech @TheVRVoice @RoblemVR @SkarredGhost

— Charlie Fink (@CharlieFink) November 27, 2018

🎄 Thinking about special ones in your life these holidays? It's all about Finding Love by @_activetheory. A virtual reality story, five distinct chapters, transforming emotions into art. Experience the #webvr magic on @supermediumvr. pic.twitter.com/Ls0j1WlbVm

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) November 28, 2018

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 132 - 138
item.description:
Part 2 of 2 of catching up. Sorry for the delays! I’ve built A-Frame Weekender, a tool for myself to get these out faster without spending hours per week.

Work has started on getting WebXR support into A-Frame, though progress on the spec is yet ongoing, browser support is limited, and feature parity with WebVR 1.1 is still not there. But something to have to do going forward. 0.9.0 should release before end of year!

Made this with @aframevr over the last couple of weeks. Find the #HiddenMickey https://t.co/XZhpRyHWOi

— Shaun (@shaunmnemonic) November 5, 2018

We just won the #ATTHack @magicleap @ATT @magicleapdevs #LifeScope #WebXR #ExoKit #XR #WebVR #VR #AR @webmixedreality @aframevr pic.twitter.com/lg5zB34yRL

— lifescopelabs (@lifescopelabs) November 12, 2018

EFF's Spot the Surveillance virtual reality project places you in a street scene, where you learn to identify a variety of police technologies. https://t.co/LuXEJu8atV

— EFF (@EFF) November 23, 2018

As part of our collaborative #nomadproject with @abirahussein we’ve made these #webar @aframevr postcards. Objects and sounds from @britishmuseum @powellcotton @britishlibrary. For more information about the project visit https://t.co/2iOJx3n2Od pic.twitter.com/5Ydwc0US7v

— Mnemoscene (@mnemoscene_ltd) October 30, 2018

🕸️🕷️💀 Dust the cobwebs off your headset and take a visit into Creepville. It's HalloVReen! Released by the spooky artist known as @jorgefuentesnet, now playing on @supermediumvr! pic.twitter.com/7YwSvh9xgM

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) October 29, 2018

Big internal performance optimizations to @aframevr core:

🚯 Nix all garbage in component update path. Hundreds of KBs of memory per second on stress test. https://t.co/DCavPbD7T2
🚄 Simplify direct component update path. 2x boost for setAttribute. https://t.co/Wn0MKYLy4O

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) November 12, 2018

Just shared on Github an @aframevr immersive video component, with themeable control bar, 360/180, mono/stereo, with just one line. Meant to combine two old components I did https://t.co/yq1GpHXQV6 pic.twitter.com/ondhj3Zmpw

— Óscar Marín (@oscarmarinmiro) November 22, 2018

👐 Need someone to talk to? Put on a little show with these cute hand "vuppets" by @jorgefuentesnet! Built with @aframevr #webvr. Now playing on @supermediumvr. pic.twitter.com/UZFHAITWr4

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) November 26, 2018

Playing with new @aframevr particle generator component https://t.co/dqLxmQbw5E for #codevember #fire https://t.co/si5zFRPZiO pic.twitter.com/Px5SlvORzx

— Kieran Farr (@kfarr) November 17, 2018

Untitled (WIP)
Made with @oculusmedium and #AFramevr
•
•
•
•
•#worldbuilder #artwithoutlimits #Oculusmedium #vrfineart #augmentedpictures #vrstorytelling #anime #virutalreality #augmentedreality #oculus #oculuslaunchpad #afrofuturist #afrocyber… https://t.co/PXMlsoJ3JU pic.twitter.com/jRnsjOMlsh

— Will Roberts (@WillieRO) November 20, 2018

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 129 - 132
item.description:
Sorry, I haven’t been able to get these roundups out! Been focusing on building an A-Frame game and working on A-Frame itself. This is part 1 of 2 of catching up. I plan on building a tool to help me get these out faster and more frequently.

Woohoo! The @W3Awards'18 winners have been announced and we are proud to have won 🥇&🥈 for the multiple award-winning Camry WebGL Configurator (https://t.co/HZ1iCKJYnW) built using @aframevr and #threejs 🥳 pic.twitter.com/F1SL3NFUZR

— Rotor Studios (@rotorstudios) October 11, 2018

VR & AR demo of new terrain visualization component for @aframevr, built on Three-geo #GIS library from @w3reality. #HoloLens #MR pic.twitter.com/mhGbu7y2Ub

— Blue Penguin VR (@BluePenguinVR) October 2, 2018

Updated @aframevr particle player component for a 2x to 4x boost in performance by merging into a single buffer geometry and fiddling vertices. https://t.co/qjI0jhEnSr pic.twitter.com/nnK9LavMER

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) September 25, 2018

Here is a first look at something weve been developing in the studio lately. No unreal engine or unity, baked light courtesy of @CoronaRenderer the rest is all custom code and #webgl tools using @aframevr #CGI #configurator #interactive #3D #kitchen @kb__eye @kbbdaily pic.twitter.com/uweVu7n2Ix

— Pikcells (@PikcellsUK) September 28, 2018
item.content:encoded:
Sorry, I haven’t been able to get these roundups out! Been focusing on building an A-Frame game and working on A-Frame itself. This is part 1 of 2 of catching up. I plan on building a tool to help me get these out faster and more frequently.

Woohoo! The @W3Awards'18 winners have been announced and we are proud to have won 🥇&🥈 for the multiple award-winning Camry WebGL Configurator (https://t.co/HZ1iCKJYnW) built using @aframevr and #threejs 🥳 pic.twitter.com/F1SL3NFUZR

— Rotor Studios (@rotorstudios) October 11, 2018

VR & AR demo of new terrain visualization component for @aframevr, built on Three-geo #GIS library from @w3reality. #HoloLens #MR pic.twitter.com/mhGbu7y2Ub

— Blue Penguin VR (@BluePenguinVR) October 2, 2018

Updated @aframevr particle player component for a 2x to 4x boost in performance by merging into a single buffer geometry and fiddling vertices. https://t.co/qjI0jhEnSr pic.twitter.com/nnK9LavMER

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) September 25, 2018

Here is a first look at something weve been developing in the studio lately. No unreal engine or unity, baked light courtesy of @CoronaRenderer the rest is all custom code and #webgl tools using @aframevr #CGI #configurator #interactive #3D #kitchen @kb__eye @kbbdaily pic.twitter.com/uweVu7n2Ix

Sneak peek of a little VR demo I want to hack on with attendees of @vue_london - using @vuejs and @aframevr! 😻 Inspired by the amazing homepage animation @sarah_edo built. 🙂 pic.twitter.com/8acmffsURH

— Chris Fritz (@chrisvfritz) September 16, 2018

#3d #learning & #education experience using #AR. Case study and app coming soon to learn #hindi #english and #punjabi alphabets #fun #edtech #webvr #webar #javascript #angularjs #magicavoxel

Components

My @aframevr component which provides a control that works across all devices, https://t.co/KWymbSUk9c is now available as an NPM component, or via the URL https://t.co/LpEAHinGS4@^1.0.1/aframe-button-controls.js #responsivedesign

— Doug Reeder (@reeder29) October 4, 2018

My @aframevr component which provides a drop-in replacement for look-controls, but ensures the virtual horizon is parallel to the physical horizon in magic-window mode, is now available: https://t.co/kgjvSmbRYx or via the URL https://t.co/jyi2ODjBcX@^1.0.0/look-controls-z.js

— Doug Reeder (@reeder29) October 4, 2018

Really wanted outlines for object selection in @aframevr; but post-processing effects destroy performance on the GO. This "inverse-shell" method should work for now :)

I wonder if I should go read some GFX books from the Gamecube era for better tips on non-screen-space effects. pic.twitter.com/w3TceapTf3

— Anthony Scavarelli (@PlumCantaloupe) September 24, 2018

New release of aframe-charts-component https://t.co/0sInJtV87r Data visualization in #VR, based on @aframevr https://t.co/jQkfHT4W1d Now with grids, popups, legends, new viz, and much more pic.twitter.com/IqeS36EHLM

— JM Gonzalez-Barahona (@jgbarah) October 3, 2018

Articles

Tutorial: crea realidad aumentada con elementos geométricos @aframevr #arjs https://t.co/MMrTDGQro1 #ar #augmentedreality #realidadaumentada

— Emilio Vegas AR/VR/MR (@emiliusvgs) September 26, 2018

Here is my final @oculus launchpad blogpost on where @circlesxr was, where we are, and where we are going with some brief thoughts about the overall process of working with @aframevr, #WebVR, and #VR in #education. https://t.co/D9bWJclRyM pic.twitter.com/nEFANOUZVx

— Anthony Scavarelli (@PlumCantaloupe) October 9, 2018

Fancy building VR apps with @aframevr ? Now can you can make them multiplayer too! Learn how from this tutorial: https://t.co/LUxMbqWfvD pic.twitter.com/Ioc08uwUI0

— Ably Realtime (@ablyrealtime) October 12, 2018

Events

When @rvdleun decides to present a 10-minute blaze-through lightning talk of the #WebXR API, React VR & @aframevr at the #fronteers jam sessions — in a Lenovo Mirage AR headset 🙃 😎✨ pic.twitter.com/zhHq1de3sZ

— 𝔣𝔩𝔞𝔨𝔦 (@slsoftworks) October 4, 2018

Les participants du premier atelier realite virtuelle avec l'@AUF_org ocean indien a l'Ile Maurice testent leur creation @AFrameVR via @SupermediumVR sur des casques @HTCVive et Vive Pro 🙌

D'une page blanche a un monde virtuel en quelques dizaines de minutes ! pic.twitter.com/wP5Iztzw4G

— Fabien Benetou (@utopiah) October 2, 2018

Grand Success of conducting Immersive Web Workshop🌟 #WebXR @aframevr along with @narendrasantho1 & @santosheswaran at G.R.D. College, Coimbatore as part of @TiE_Coimbatore Hackathon & @Facebook Dev Circles Coimbatore !

Some slides below ✌ #ImmersiveWeb #WebVR pic.twitter.com/3vwsZ4s83Z

— Karan Ganesan (@karanganesan) October 1, 2018

What if you could start your #VR projects in minutes and test it on the best available hardware right away? Participants to the very 1st #WebXR workshop in Mauritius via @AUF_org managed to do just that this afternoon using free and open web tools like @aframevr 😍 pic.twitter.com/vS9KdSYWqe

— Fabien Benetou (@utopiah) October 2, 2018

Our own @marta_bondyra is rocking the stage at #hackference inviting audience to test her WebVR+ Web speech Harry Potter themed hack using @aframevr

💻🧙‍♀️✨✨ pic.twitter.com/WA9skE4Tjc

— Nicolas Grenié (@picsoung) October 12, 2018

Miscellaneous

@supermediumvr made WebVR suddenly viable in my mind, by making it feel like a native desktop experience.

Have started tinkering with @aframevr, super easy to get a scene going, not as easy to get interaction. I've gotten distracted since but will have to pick it up again soon.

— Andreas Aronsson (@BOLL7708) October 7, 2018

@aframevr and its community remains independent. Worth checking all the progress made in the last 3 years. @toyota (https://t.co/XEUoYXgN81) or @ford (https://t.co/CKorkxw1Zp) recently kicked the tires (literally 🙂)

— Diego (@dmarcos) October 8, 2018

Pretty cool to see @Vimeo venturing into #WebVR and in particular going deeper (see what I did there…) than 360s cf https://t.co/31beCeqeEi and https://t.co/5K5IBBaGd0 even with presence on the @AFrameVR Slack 👍

— Fabien Benetou (@utopiah) October 9, 2018

That was a very interesting HTML5 Meetup WEBVR session yesterday given by @benoitpiette!! 👏 👏

Discovered yesterday AWS has also smt like https://t.co/UwvWmG5hCy to build VR application.

Check also @aframevr website 😅😅 (go to Menu Anime UI, and play) pic.twitter.com/QfaOPgYOtC

— кг|sтоf вегиаегт (@ssstofff) October 10, 2018

So I was just told by a colleague that his 14-year old daughter has a better understanding and is far more enthusiastic about coding after the @aframevr workshop.

Definitely gonna chalk that evening up as… pic.twitter.com/8wd8Zy8uIl

— VRuben (@rvdleun) October 12, 2018

Supermedium chillin' next to Superhot at #OC5 keynote. pic.twitter.com/jOKwaNHC3l

— Ian Petrarca (@ianpetrarca) July 23, 2018
